intro: Goekyighitia pygmaea subsp. adilii, commonly known as the Adil's dwarf bellflower, is a rare and small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct genetic and morphological traits compared to the broader species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered plant.
